content:  www ysolda com © ysolda s teague nihcru urchin by ysolda a simple garter stitch beret worked from side to side and shaped with short row i named it urchin because the texture reminds me of a sea urchin s shell while the shape is reminiscent of the caps street urchins always seem to be wearing in old photographs it s the ideal pattern to showcase an unusual bulky yarn and would look wonderful in a special handspun but it works equally well with a smooth simpler yarn urchin was originally published on knitty com  www ysolda com © ysolda s teague nihcru materials notes pink hat knit global shetland flame 96% wool urchin is knit sideways in garter stitch in a single 4% nylon yd/100m per 100g skein color pink piece composed of eight wedges shaped with short sherbet 1 skein row because it s in garter stitch there is no need grey hat lana grossa airwool 60% merino 40% to bother with picking up the wraps to finish the acrylic yd/40m per 50g skein color 005 2 2 3 beret the provisional cast on is undone and the 2 skeins sets of live stitches are grafted together for a totally seamless appearance if you aren t comfortable 1 pair 7mm straight needles with that much grafting it would be even easier but not quite so invisible to join the ends with a three waste yarn and crochet hook for provisional cast on needle bind off yarn needle you may wish to use a safety pin or similar marker size to mark the keep track of the right side of the beret womens s m l -
